questions.question_text: Which advantage does the agile process offer compared to waterfall software development?

choices.D: to fix any issues at the end of the development cycle
choices.A: to add or update features with incremental delivery
choices.B: to view the full scope of end-to-end work
choices.C: to have each phase end before the next begins

discussion.content: A is the answer. Agile uses smaller time increments or “sprints,” that encompass the full process of analysis, design, code, and test but on a much smaller aspect of an application. The goal is to finish a feature or capability for each sprint, resulting in a potentially shippable incremental piece of software.

Selected Answer: A
Agile allow make modification during each sprint

Selected Answer: A
A this is the correct answer

Selected Answer: A
Only A makes sense

Selected Answer: A
Only A makes sense.
C and D are actually from Waterfall.
B I dont even

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of the HTTP status code 204?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
To download and run an Apache web server container in Docker with a port binding of 8080 in the container to port 80 on the host, you can use the following two commands:

1. docker pull httpd:latest - This command will download the latest version of the Apache web server Docker image from the Docker Hub.

2. docker run -p 80:8080 -d httpd - This command will start a new container based on the httpd image, with a port binding of 8080 in the container to port 80 on the host. The -d flag runs the container in detached mode, meaning it will run in the background and not block the terminal.

Selected Answer: CD
"a port binding 8080 in the container to 80 on the host"
Docker documentation specifies the order "-p host:container"
C and D are correct

Selected Answer: BD
B and D period

Selected Answer: AB
To download and execute an Apache web server container in Docker with a port binding where port 8080 in the container is mapped to port 80 on the host, you need to use the docker pull command to pull the Apache image and the docker run command to start the container with the appropriate port mapping. Here are the two commands to achieve this:

Download the Apache image:

A. docker pull httpd

This command pulls the Apache HTTP Server image (httpd) from the Docker Hub.

Execute the Apache container with port mapping:

B. docker run -p 8080:80 httpd

This command runs the Apache container with port 8080 on the host mapped to port 80 in the container. The -p option specifies the port mapping.

So, options B and D are the correct commands for downloading and executing an Apache web server container with the specified port binding.

"-p=[] : Publish a container's port or a range of ports to the host
 format: ip:hostPort:containerPort"
aka 80 (host port) : 8080 (internal port)

Selected Answer: BD
As per outrageous7

Selected Answer: BD

A group of software developers wants to improve its collaboration with the operations team. The group wants to deliver release-ready code that merges code changes back to the main branch and runs the automated testing as often as possible. Which DevOps concept does this scenario represent?
